infos.title: Spiritual Guide
infos.story: This pure and kindhearted Tamian soul guide can communicate with the dead. The Tamian race lives in harmony with nature, and they have the ability to read its flow and guide the souls of the dead. Rephy's ability as a soul guide is exceptional, even for a Tamian. He uses it to guide the souls of those who died in the forest and help them pass on, preventing them from turning evil. He is the most capable among the Tamians in discerning the paths of the stars, pacelifying the souls of the dead, and properly guiding them to the afterlelife.

uw.name: God's Lamp, Kurulati
uw.description: Every 20 sec, an ally with the lowest HP turns invisible for (0) sec. An invisible ally becomes immune to P.DMG, and HP will not drop below 1%. MP Recovery per sec is increased to (1).
uw.story: It is the duty of a soul guide to lead the lost souls onto the right path, to help them move on to the next life. This lamp, powered by a mysterious orb created long ago by a dragon from a distant land, is a treasure of the Tamians. The orb at its core allows nearby souls to materialize, making it possible for its wielder to talk to them directly. As such, it is the ultimate medium for a soul guide. Tamian chieftains have used this relic to carry out the sacred duties of a soul guide for generations. Now, in the face a great danger that threatens the world, the lamp has been passed on to Rephy, the most powerful soul guide in existence.

1.description: [Healing Soul] Reduces Mana Cost by 1, and increases the target's CC ACC by (0) for the duration of skill.
1.story: A small music box containing the voice of Asiphia, Queen of Blue star. Rephy opens it when guiding souls. The souls heading to the Garden of Rest receive the grace of the Blue Star by listening to the song of Asiphia recorded in the box. When Asiphia's voice flows, twinkling like starlight, nothing dark or corrupt can come near those souls.

2.story: A collection of the energy that is created when a life is born. It's very warm and gentle, so souls like it. Rephy uses it to start a fire in a lamp to borrow the power of the souls. When a seed is put in a lamp, it shines brightly, like when the sun was first born.

3.story: An ornament that was used for the memorial ceremonies of deceased royalty in ancient times. Inside the green jewel, there's a crystallized tear of the mythical creature that leads people to death. It's used as a resting places to comfort the emptiness within souls.

4.story: A specialty of Lamp-keeper Town. This candy that looks like a blue star is Rephy's favorite snack. It is made from 'Jolt out of Sleep,' a blue herb that only grows in Lamp-keeper Town. Every time Rephy leaves town for journey, the village head always puts this candy in his pocket.

advancement.1: Inflicts hallucination upon 2 enemies and reduces the target's Mana by 500.
advancement.2: Upon activation, immediately activates the invisibility effect of God's Lamp, Kurulati on 2 allies.

sw.story:
Tamian Tribe had trained many Spiritual Guides. Kurulati was the lamp the guides used to guide the spirits, These are the extent of what Rephy knows after a conversation with the chief. However, what guides and even chiefs did not know, was that memories of guides have been piling up inside Kurulati.
That applied to Rephy as well, but one day, Rephy realized that there was another voice among the voices of spirits.
The voices were unfamiliar, yet strangely familiar at the same time.
After listening to the lamp carefully, and talking to the voice, Rephy found out that the voice came from the entity which is the cumulative of memories of all previous guides.
The entity told Rephy of what all the guides had experienced, and upon hearing them, Rephy gained a deeper understanding of the power of Kurulati which even he did not know.
The lamp shined brighter, and lost spirits could find their way to the lamp more easily through that warm light.
